main event: On 3rd July 1953 at 0215Z, in Middletown, New York, 2 civilian observers saw an unidentified flying object at a great distance, resembling an aluminum disc with a colored body and black wings. It reflected sunlight and appeared as a full-sized aircraft. The observation lasted for 1-2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was spotted at a distance of 3 to 5 miles and reflected sunlight, appearing like a full-sized aircraft.
The observers described the object as resembling an aluminum disc with a colored body and black wings.
It appeared to be stationary, reflecting sunlight, and then moved rapidly to the north before disappearing from sight.
The observers were intelligent, stable, and reliable persons. Their observation was made in good faith and there is no reason to disbelieve their story.
One of the observers estimated the size of the object to be 30 to 50 feet, resembling polished aluminum pencils with wings.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object resembling an aluminum disc with colored body and black wings
